questions.question_text: What was counted to Abraham as righteousness?
questions.hint: Abraham's belief in God's promises was credited to him.

questions.question_text: According to Romans, why is the promise to Abraham and his descendants based on faith?
questions.option3: So that it might be by grace
questions.hint: Grace ensures that the promise is certain for all descendants of Abraham.

questions.question_text: In Romans 4, who is Abraham considered the father of?
questions.hint: It's related to faith, not physical lineage or religious rituals.

questions.question_text: What specific event or promise in Abraham’s life does Paul highlight as a model of faith in Romans 4?
questions.hint: It involves believing in God's power to fulfill His promises against all odds.

questions.question_text: What does Paul say was written for the benefit of believers about Abraham's faith?
questions.option3: His faith was counted to him for righteousness
questions.hint: The principle by which Abraham was justified is also applicable to believers."}]}]}  The focus is on the principle used for justification.

questions.question_text: Which aspect of God did Abraham believe in that was key to his faith being counted as righteousness?
questions.hint: Abraham believed God brings life to the dead and calls things that are not as though they are.

questions.question_text: To whom does the promise depend on faith, according to Romans 4?
questions.option3: Those who are descendants of Ishmael
questions.option4: All the seed of Abraham through faith
questions.hint: The promise is not limited by the law or physical descent.

questions.question_text: What characteristic of Abraham's faith led him not to stagger at God's promise through unbelief?
questions.hint: Abraham was "fully persuaded" that God could fulfill His promises.

questions.question_text: What reason does Paul give for Abraham being the heir of the world in Romans 4?
questions.hint: The promise to Abraham was not through the law but through this aspect of faith.

questions.question_text: What does Romans 4 say will also be credited to us who believe?
questions.option4: Righteousness for believing in Him who raised Jesus from the dead
questions.hint: The principle by which Abraham was justified is the same for those who have faith in the resurrection of Jesus.
